Detailed Description

template<class T>
class ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >

Derived from CArray2D this class offers subindexing and origo, last updated 1/25/2002.

Read more about the functionality in the base class CArray2D. The feature subindexing means, you specify how many subindexes you want between two subsequent integer values when you construct the object or call Alloc(). If subindexing is set to 1, indexes with stepsize 0.5 are valid, see example below. Origo works like the IPL98 image classes, simply offsets the (0,0) index. An iterator class is available, read more in the base class and the iterator classes CArray2DConstIterator and CArray2DIterator. 

        // initializes an array and prints a row and colomn from it
        int x1=5,y1=3;
        CArrayOS2D<double> Arr1(x1,y1,1); // subindexing is 1, hence step size is 0.5

        for(double C1=0; C1<x1; C1+=Arr1.GetSubStep())
                for(double C2=0; C2<y1; C2+=Arr1.GetSubStep())
                        Arr1[C1][C2]=x1*C1+C2;

        cout << Arr1 << endl;
        cout << "Index [0.5][1.5]=" << Arr1[0.5][1.5] << endl;
        // print a row
        cout << "Row 2: ";
        CArrayOS2D<double>::ConstIterator it1=Arr1.ConstRow(2);
        for(; it1!=it1.End(); it1++)
                cout << *it1 << " ";
        // print a column
        it1=Arr1.ConstColumn(2);
        cout  << endl << "Column 2: ";
        for(; it1!=it1.End(); it1++)
                cout << *it1 << " ";

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
0.35, by edr@mip.sdu.dk
Author:
René Dencker Eriksen

template<class T>
typedef CArrayOS2DConstIterator<T> ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::ConstIterator
 

Constant iterator for the CArrayOS2D class.

This typedef is included to make the class work like the std library. Instantiate a const iterator object like this: 

                        CArrayOS2D<T>::ConstIterator it;

Member Function Documentation

template<class T>
bool ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::Alloc (  UINT32    x,
UINT32    y,
unsigned int    SubIndexing = 0
)  [virtual]
 

Sets the size of array, origo is not changed.

It is not efficient to reallocate the matrix, if size is known at creation time, use the constructor once for all.

Parameters:
x  Integer width of array, note actual array will contain (SubIndexing+1)*x elements.
y  Integer height of array, note actual array will contain (SubIndexing+1)*y elements.
SubIndexing  the number of sub indices present between two neighbouring integer values
Returns :
false, if allocation failed or if SubIndexing is 0.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::CopySubArray (  const CArrayOS2D< T > &    Source,
const CPoint2D< double > &    UpperLeft,
const CPoint2D< double > &    LowerRight
) 
 

Copies a CArrayOS2D to this array.

The positions UpperLeft and LowerRight specifies the rectangle to be copied including the specified values, both relative to origo. The method uses integers because of origo offset which may force the user to use values less than zero. If you want the resulting array placed in this array just use the same object for SourceArray. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary array to the destination).

Parameters:
UpperLeft  position in the upper left corner to start from (including value).
LowerLeft  position in the lower left corner to stop at (including value).
Returns :
false if outside array

Definition at line 914 of file arrayos2d.h.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::CopySubArray (  const CArrayOS2D< T > &    Source,
double    xmin,
double    ymin,
double    xmax,
double    ymax
) 
 

Copies a CArrayOS2D to this array.

The positions (xmin,ymin) and (xmax,ymax) specifies the rectangle to be copied including the specified values. The method uses integers because of origo offset which may force the user to use values less than zero. If you want the resulting array placed in this array just use the same object for SourceArray. Note: In that case the method is a bit slower (needs to copy a temporary array to the destination).

Parameters:
xmin  defines left side of rectangle in source to copy from (including this value).
ymin  defines top side of rectangle in source to copy from (including this value).
xmax  defines right side of rectangle in source to copy from (including this value).
ymax  defines buttom side of rectangle in source to copy from (including this value).
Returns :
false if outside array

)  const [inline]
 

Returns the value at (x,y) rounded to nearest sub index in array.

Includes range check, if out of range, the value at origo is returned.

y  Row relative to origo.

Definition at line 521 of file arrayos2d.h.

References ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::GetNearestSubIndex(), CPoint2D< int >::GetX(), CPoint2D< int >::GetY(), ipl::CArray2D< T >::m_Height, ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::m_OrigoCells, and ipl::CArray2D< T >::m_Width.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::Load (  const char *    pPathAndFileName )  [virtual]
 

Load file from disk.

File must be in correct format according to how the Save() method formats output. Note: There is no check at the moment whether the type T of this class is the same as the array being read, reading from a file with another template type leads to undefined results. Note: Comment lines (starting with a #) and whitespace can be put anywhere within the stream.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/myarrayos2d.bmp", relative "myarrayos2d.txt". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path, but remember to escape a "\" character (i.e. write "\"), otherwise it will be interpreted as a control character.
Returns :
false if load failed.

Reimplemented from ipl::CArray2D< T >.

template<class T>
ConstIterator ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::operator[] (  double    i )  const [inline]
 

Returns a const iterator for column i.

Use another [] to index the row number. To make the indexing as fast as possible, the value of i is asumed to be a valid subindex, if an indexing at nearest valid subindex value is wanted use the Get or GetFast medthods instead.

See also:
Get , GetFast

Returns an iterator for column i.

Use another [] to index the row number. To make the indexing as fast as possible, the value of i is asumed to be a valid subindex, if an indexing at nearest valid subindex value is wanted use the Get, Set, GetFast or SetFast medthods instead.

template<class T>
bool ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::Save (  const char *    pPathAndFileName )  [virtual]
 

Save file to disk.

First a comment line is generated, then a token "CArrayOS2D", then a token "Dimensions:" followed by two integers (width and height), then a token "Origo:" followed by (x,y), then a token "SubIndexing:" followed by the sub indexing number (see m_SubIndexing). After that the 2D array is written. Each element is written using the streaming operator on that element.

Parameters:
pPathAndFileName  Name of file including extension and relative or absolute path, f.ex. absolut path "c:/temp/myarray2d.txt", relative "myarray2d.txt". Both slash ("/") and back slash ("\") can be used in the path, but remember to escape a "\" character (i.e. write "\"), otherwise it will be interpreted as a control character.
Returns :
True, if saved.

Reimplemented from ipl::CArray2D< T >.

Friends And Related Function Documentation

template<class T>
ostream& operator<< (  ostream &    s,
const CArrayOS2D< T > &    Array
)  [friend]
 

Writes all data to stream.

Format is: 

                        Dimensions: w h
                        Origo: (xh,yh)
                        SubIndexing: s
                        x0y0 x1y0 x2y0 ...
                        x0y1 x1y1 x2y1 ...
                        ...

Where w, h is width and height respectively, s is subindexing, and (xh,yh) is origo. Note: Due to problems with Visual C++ 6.0 and Borland 5.0 with template classes and friend functions, the definition needs to be in the header declaration, it helps a bit (but not in all cases) to bypass the bugs.

Version:
0.3

template<class T>
istream& operator>> (  istream &    is,
ipl::CArrayOS2D< T > &    Array
)  [friend]
 

Reads input from given stream into this class.

Stream must be in correct format according to how the << ostream operator formats output. Note: Due to problems with Visual C++ 6.0 and Borland 5.0 with template classes and friend functions, the definition needs to be in the header declaration, it helps a bit (but not in all cases) to bypass the bugs.

Version:
0.3

template<class T>
CPoint2D<int> ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::m_OrigoCells [protected]
 

Contains the offset counted in cells in array.

Note, it is the cell offset, not the unit length offset, this is to avoid a multiplication when used internally.

template<class T>
unsigned int ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::m_SubIndexing [protected]
 

The granularity of the array.

Holds the number of sub indices minus 1 present between two neighbouring integer values. If value is 4, it is possible to get a value at each position (0.25*i, 0.25*j), where i and j are integers. Note: This value has been added one from the parameter value given when creating this object or calling Alloc! This has been done in order to optimize speed internally.

template<class T>
double ipl::CArrayOS2D< T >::m_SubStep [protected]
 

Sub step size for this array.

It is always set to (1/m_SubIndexing), but is is convenient to have the value precalculated.
